Sec. 29-5.1. Reassessment of certain properties.
In the event any single family residential unit is found to have been converted into multi-family housing, the Property Appraiser upon notification shall re-examine the assessed value of the property and if he determines that portions of said property have escaped taxation as a result of the change in use he shall, to the extent permitted by state law, review his assessment and back assess the property for up to three (3) preceding years. If permitted by state law, such back assessment shall also include removal of or adjustment to any homestead exception which was improperly granted.
